conclusion: To solve the problem, the image will be analyzed to identify how liquid flows from points A, B, C, D through baffles into containers E or F.
The image shows four inflow points labeled A, B, C, and D positioned above two containers, E and F, separated by baffles.
The baffles direct the flow, ensuring the liquid enters one specific container.
The direction of flow from each point (A, B, C, D) can be identified based on the layout and the presence of baffles.
Point A is aligned towards container F.
Point A directly flows into container F due to its alignment and the baffles' direction.
Point B flows into container F, as it continues the path initiated by point A.
Point C flows into container F by following the path established by points A and B.
Point D flows into container E, possibly due to a change in direction created by the baffles.
Liquid will flow into container E based on the flow directions and baffles' influence.
